alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 4:15AM MDT until April 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Dodson affecting Phillips County. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Dodson. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.2 feet, Lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 23.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 08/26/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Dodson 23.0 21.1 Sun 3 am MDT 23.1 21.9 20.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning by 1100 AM MDT.
